page.title: 18INTERVIEW WITH RECTOR
page.content: Mr Bilney felt he was being called to be a priest 16yrs ago after being an engineer. Bishop Richard Rutt asked him to take the United Benefice, once approved by the Queen, Privy Council and Church Wardens. Most services are at Dunton Bassett being the largest of the three churches. Mr Bilney likes each church in its own right. No other member of his family have been in the Church, but in the 15th century a Thomas Bilney was martyred and burnt at the stake. There is little contact with other religions; only Christians go to the three churches. Mr Bilney wears clothes dated from Roman times. His favourite service is Holy Communion because of the sharing of a meal as one family. His favourite Bible story is Matthew Ch.25v35-45 and favourite prayer that of St. Francis. {By Christopher Carver. Age 8.}
